page.title: 01North and South Queensferry
page.content: South Queensferry_small town,pop (1981) 8111,lying at southern end of the two Forth Bridges.Church of Scotland,Catholic Church,Episcopal Church_still uses 15thC Carmelite Priory.17thC Hawes Inn mentioned in Scott's"The Antiquary"and Stevenson's "Kidnapped".Burgh's Royal Charters and other documents in local museum open Tues.Wed.Thurs.2.30_4.30.Wed.aft. early closing.Sailing and windsurfing at Port Edgar Marina.Buses to Edinburgh,Falkirk,Bo'ness. North Queensferry_village,pop(1981) 906,lying between the two Forth Bridges on the north bank of the River Forth.Local Heritage Trail.Church of Scotland.Bus to Dunfermline.Harbour provides a popular anchorage for sailing and speedboats.
